name: mrphaethon
text: That player has hell of pride.

name: jack_samson
text: After the search function came on the site, I went looking for "kettle" just to know exactly how much water Mr. Bear recommends storing in the kettle.  Now my kettles are residue free.  Thank you Achewood.

name: zaratustra
text: but but that's dangerous! mosquitos lay eggs on still water!

name: relaxing
text: you should probably not have many mosquitoes inside your home.

name: killerlimpet
text: No you shouldn't; it could create problems in the community!

name: zaratustra
text: A comment left by zaratustra was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, riotdejaneiro, kylank, Anderian, ketamind, cailetshadow, Shinkicka)

name: srikamaraja
text: If you keep a live Guppy in your teapot, it will consume any mosquito-progeny-to-be.

name: greenkoolayd
text: the live guppy will get fat because of the ambient grease that the water catches.

name: pan-optic
text: really, you can get a complete ecosystem going on there without much effort.

name: greenkoolayd
text: an excellent science fair project for children!  "mini ecosystem in a teapot"

name: mockereo
text: Guppy-poop tea is not my favourite

name: srikamaraja
text: You know SO. LITTLE.

name: mockereo
text: better than lipton though

name: terribleman
text: For the sake of tea drinking people's health (who am I to judge?), I think it should be pointed out that mr. Bear is, in fact, not recommending storing water in your kettle.

name: terriblerobot
text: Exactly how did you come by this conclusion? Seems to me not having a hard to clean residue of grease and dust would be a major plus.

name: terribleman
text: If the water catches all that dust and whatnot, and then is allowed to evaporate, it will create a hard, white crust that is hard to get off. You can read the sentence both ways, I now see. In the version I chose to read, Mr. Bear was scolding Teodor for not properly drying his kettle before putting it away.

name: terriblerobot
text: Aha! Yes, I can see it from that point of view now as well.

name: cromulent
text: "Put butter on what I said!" is one of those Achewood phrases that you would love to use at some point in your life, but you know you probably never will.  At least not in the right context and with the same effect.

name: digdugz
text: I notice a ton of those motherfuckers in conversations between Ray and Beef.

name: dougthehead
text: Another would be "The HELL I just walked home from Mexico!"  I have half a mind to drive to Mexico and walk home simply so I can say that line.

name: lizjones
text: It's just like when Ramses Luther says "I just beat the asses of three thousand men. The hell you leave me alone."

name: deusoma
text: I used "The hell you leave me alone" once, but sadly I have not yet beaten the asses of 3,000 men.

name: rowboat
text: I think affectionate slaps and/or pinches to the naked asses of men count, so you're good.

name: soticoto
text: That is the sort of remark that could summon Retardo... Careful.

name: boredom_man
text: Me too. I live in El Paso.

name: evilbobikus
text: I've walked home from Mexico and have been able to use this line.  I passed out before I could even think of butter though.

name: nicolae
text: Sounds like my mother, I swear

name: saint
text: i got to take Ray's line in panel 6 for a walk at Applebee's the other day. didn't compare at all

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Fred Sanford could have said that.

name: lordpretzel
text:
"I, like, say this all the time with my friends now."

^ Almost every other comment referring to a specific line.

name: magb
text: I wasn't all that into the Lonis F. Edison arc, but this strip ended it on a perfect note.

name: howard
text: No player should ever be seen in a loose thong. That shit ain't jazz.

name: rogergs
text: Ray was reduced to tying fetching bows in the side strings to reduce its circumference.  Such attention to detail is why I love Achewood -- Method cartooning, complete empathy with the travails of a rapidly slimming Speedo-wearing cat in the Mexican desert.

name: anomalous3
text: Fuck you, diabetes.

name: greenkoolayd
text: word.  diabetes usually likes to chill with people of gravity.

name: epicurus
text: I have felt fractions of the way Ray feels at times. 4/5, very awesome.

name: hexjumper
text:
This is another example of Ray's character in a nutshell: Not only does he walk across a desert by himself rather than ride home with a rival, he refuses to get his own money from his friends because he doesn't want to leave a bad impression on somebody that he'll never meet again.

I mean, just the way that he stands in the fourth panel - he's emaciated, ragged, and dirty, but still barking orders for his friends to serve him food, with butter.

name: caduceo
text: A comment left by caduceo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DaPooka, ButterMoths, Rhadamanthus, silver_lake, incredibledeath, riotdejaneiro, HonestTom, goatmasterflash, mashisoyo, equinn2006, TombsGrave, Lumus, huskemonge, Breadcrab, mugi, Boredom_Man, prowle4763, perhapsmaybe, dr_sexlove, Darthemed, SotiCoto)

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Yeah, this is not my favorite arc, but "somebody cook me some damn Emeril food!" is worth its weight in gold.

name: soticoto
text:
You know what I wanna say Dog...
... but I've said it enough.

Eat Lame.

name: soticoto
text: Holy crap. I did not get lamed for laming this once. W00t!

name: phthoggos
text: What the hell is Téodor wearing?

name: katsura
text: looks like longjohns to me.

name: cdl146
text: A comment left by cdl146 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by goocifer, jocelynthepink, dracer2)

name: biddlebubbly
text: Man the delectable quips are packed in tighter than is probably even recommended.

name: steerpike66
text: Tighter than a turkey stuffed with lasagne?

name: tagrineth
text: And every bit as delicious

name: miku224
text: Chubbies for all three of you!

name: _cheesekayke
text:
Whenever anyone says "This is my favorite strip," I'm always like, "How the hell can you pick a favorite? I can hardly pick my Top 10!"
But reading through the archives a second time on AssetBar, I have come to realize that this is definitely my favorite strip, and it deserves so much higher than a 4.6.

name: clever-nickname
text:
Spider bite getting tennis lessons?

Only achewood can inspire such thoughts.

name: heccibiggs
text: That line clinched this comic as a five for me. The sheer absurdity of it.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, PresterJohn, mashisoyo, coffeecoaster, Doc_Rostov)

name: spinynorman
text: Cornelius really deserves the Badass award if he's capable of delivering that stiff-upper-lip bringdown on Ray in the last panel, even under such alarming circumstances.

name: jdhenry105
text: Why are his knees bloody?  Dear me why are his knees bloody?

name: paco
text: I believe it would be because during his ordeal in Mexico, someone took a fancy to "busting some caps" in his knees.

name: soticoto
text: More like he beat an entire gang of Hell's Angels to death with his knees .

name: selbencoirlo
text:
Or maybe he FELL, goddammit. Is occam's razor gonna have to cut a bitch?

Though to be fair I don't think occam's razor applies in achewood.

name: wozzeck
text: In Achewood it is Lonis's Razor: The simplest explanation for a phenomenon is most likely Mexican Magical Realism.

name: mountaindewtab
text: holy shit

name: steerpike66
text: There is some solid-GOLD dialog in this one. Anger and famine really whets Ray's repartee.

name: shogun
text: The cats days of having to find a doubles partner at the last minute have come to an end.

name: trollcollins
text:
Panels 3-9 are hilarious, character-driven comedy gold.

Panels 1-2 are an important PSA. Because of them, my kettles are free of ambient grease and dust!

See, this is one reason why I love Achewood. I laugh, I learn .

name: wittyname
text: Just panel 4 is what made it a 5.

name: contrasoma
text:
"Why didn't you wire for help?"

*insert cliched line about Connie's old-school bad-assery*

name: saru
text:
I'm really joining the chorus on this one, such as preaching to the choir, and other aphorisms of all that sort.
But damn this is an awesome strip. It doesn't let up. "Cook me up some Emeril food," "The Hell I just walked home from Mexico," The kettle PSA, the cow sized steak sandwich, lasagna stuffed turkey with butter on it, spider bite taking tennis lessons, jeez, is so good.

name: nigelchaos
text: Ray in Panel four made me laugh out loud. He looks like death kept in a fridge for a week, growing some weird fungal spots and then microwaved for like, a week.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by MrFlunchy, Doc_Rostov, morbo)

name: spicyponyhead
text: And then once it was in there, you'd be like "That'll do, pig."

name: chachibenji
text:
WHERES THE BUTTER, PUT BUTTER ON WHAT I SAID.
Awesome.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Mr. Bear: Pub Name Backpedal

name: shutup_shutup
text: Walking home from Mexico will really make you reconsider if you want to open a bar called Sit Down Fat Dog.

name: rowboat
text: I love the rare occasion in which I find a post of yours which I haven't yet chubbied. It's very comforting to rectify that situation. It's one constant in this crazy barrio. It's "Chubby the Blog Girl and then into the fuckin' fray."

name: mulisha7
text: "Four damn leg holes in the bun! Just walk it to the table and shoot it!" Awesome. Even though he seems to be describing a pig instead of a cow.

name: wartooth
text: that line is so zaphod beeblebrox at the restaurant at the end of the universe. let me meet my meat!

name: invidious
text: And, in the BBC mini-series, his meat ending up being a wonderful cameo by Peter Davison, also known as the Fifth Doctor.

name: charchar
text: Did his shades lose a lens or are they just hell of gungey after being used to fend off gila monsters and zombie saguaro cacti?

name: fubbied
text: This strip.

name: boswelljn
text:
I love this strip.

I wanted to do something more than just Five it, so I created an account and made the above comment so that I could chubby the strip as well.

Is "fubbied" better than "chived"?

name: echidnaboy
text: I wish I could Fubby your resourcefulness. Here, have a chubby and a Pro. Think of it as a Prubby or a Cho[chacho?]

name: jonmw
text: Yet another sign that Ray gravitated to the main character of the strip. He's apparently gone for weeks, and yet we have just one strip of what happens among the other characters in Ray's absence.

name: mashisoyo
text: Nah - there were others. Puking in a dishwasher, etc.

name: fireking
text: Whenever I walk into somewhere I have not been for some time, I always announce "The HELL I just walked home from Mexico" in an annoyed, albeit slightly proud voice.

name: red-barchetta
text: THIS is one of the best. Ever.

name: lolsworth
text: Everything Ray says in this strip is the best dialogue ever written.

name: greenkoolayd
text: if he wants butter, he should have asked for paula deen food.

name: adult_beverages
text: Phillipe fantasizes about driving Emeril's limo

name: greenkoolayd
text: that sounds dirty.....

name: sevenslashfour
text: This is why I love Ray.

name: duperando
text: "Walk it to the table and shoot it" Makes me think of the strip in which Ray says "Food chain! get used to it!"

name: rowboat
text: Ray has a complicated relationship with his dinner.
